comments.body:
@jpivarski Can you confirm if you're happy to be listed as a maintainer?

I don't mind doing the maintenance like I do with awkward and uproot.

Quite happy to be listed. (The only downside I've found is that the number of repos that I could possibly have in continuous integration taxes Travis and AppVeyor!) I want to be aware of how this works, at least.

@jpivarski Am I missing any optional dependencies that you would like to have here?

When grepping I noticed `fnal_column_analysis_tools`, `pandas` and `root` are also imported.

This is an open-ended set of things, so it wouldn't be a good precedent to start requiring them in the conda package. (This isn't like uproot, where there's a fixed set of things you might want, but I didn't want to include in the pip package.)

Also, `fnal_column_analysis_tools` isn't on PyPI, yet, I think.

Bottom line: I think it would be fine for the conda package to have exactly the same dependencies as the pip package. (Probably easier to maintain that way, too.)
